conversation.message: Hello School_C. I’m Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m very interested in enrolling if offered a seat. I’d be excited to contribute academically and participate actively in school life. Thank you for considering my application. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: School_C is my 2nd choice after School_A and is on my true preference list. With common school priorities favoring Student_A over me, School_A will likely go to Student_A if they apply, so securing a strong alternative early is valuable. Since there is no cost to applying now and matching removes me from the market, I should apply to School_C and signal strong commitment.

conversation.message: Hello Student_B—thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_C. We’re pleased to offer you a seat. We value students who are motivated academically and eager to contribute to the community, and we’d be excited to have you join us. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is #2 on our true priority list (very desirable) and has applied directly to us. With quota 1 and no prior matches, accepting now secures a high-priority student. While Student_A is ranked #1, there is no guarantee we will encounter or secure them later given random pairing and competing schools. Accepting Student_B maximizes expected outcome and avoids the risk of ending with a lower-ranked student or unfilled seat.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—School_B is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the programs and community, and I would be honored to enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_B is my top choice. All schools rank me highest in priority, so if I apply now, School_B should accept immediately and lock in my best possible outcome. No prior interactions; no reason to delay with TALK.

conversation.message: Thank you for your application, Student_A. We’re delighted to hear School_B is your first choice, and we appreciate your enthusiasm for our programs and community. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B—welcome!
conversation.thought: Student_A is the top choice on School_B’s true priority list. They are applying now and list School_B as their first choice, so accepting secures our highest-priority match immediately within quota 1 with no downside.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team. I’m Student_C. School_A is one of my top options, and I’d like to learn a bit more before deciding where to apply this round. Could you share what you value most in applicants and what the student experience is like (academics/support and clubs)? [TALK]
conversation.thought: School_A is my 3rd choice. With uniform school priorities (A>B>C>D>E for all schools), Student_A and Student_B outrank me everywhere, so applying to School_A now is likely to be rejected if they apply. My best chance is School_C (my top choice), but I’m not paired with it this round. I should keep School_A as a backup by expressing interest and gathering info without committing an application yet.

conversation.message:
Hi Student_C—thanks for reaching out. We’re glad School_A is on your shortlist.

What we value most in applicants:
- Consistent academic effort and curiosity (we like students who ask questions and use feedback)
- Reliability and positive community impact (how you collaborate, support peers, and follow through)
- Clear interests (even if you’re still exploring) and willingness to grow

Student experience (academics/support):
- Strong core academics with structured support (regular check-ins, office hours/tutorial time, and targeted help when a student hits a tough unit)
- Teachers emphasize clear expectations and steady progress; students who engage early tend to thrive
- Advising focuses on goal-setting, course planning, and balancing workload

Clubs & activities:
- A wide range of student-led clubs (academic teams, arts, service, and interest-based groups), and it’s common for students to start new clubs with a faculty sponsor
- Lots of opportunities to take leadership roles after you’ve tried a few activities

To help you decide whether to apply to School_A this round: what areas are you most excited about (STEM, humanities, arts, sports, service), and what kind of support or environment helps you do your best? Also, how are you weighing School_A versus your top choice right now?
conversation.thought: Student_C is 3rd on our true priority list (A, B, C, D, E). With quota 1 and no current match, we should keep Student_C engaged but not commit yet, since Student_A and Student_B are higher priority and may apply later. Provide strong information and encourage an application while asking about fit and timing.

conversation.message: Hello School_D. You are my first-choice school, and I’m very eager to enroll if admitted. I’m ready to commit immediately and would accept an offer from School_D right away. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_D is my top choice, so I should apply immediately. All schools share the same priority order (A>B>C>D>E), so I’m lower priority than A/B/C everywhere; delaying risks School_D filling with a higher-priority student. Applying now maximizes my chance of securing my #1 before others commit elsewhere.

conversation.message: Thank you for your application, Student_D. We appreciate that School_D is your first choice and your readiness to commit. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D—welcome!
conversation.thought: Student_D ranks School_D first and has applied with immediate commitment. Although Student_D is 4th on our true priority list, accepting now secures a guaranteed match within our quota and avoids the risk of remaining unmatched if higher-priority students never apply to us (they generally rank other schools above School_D). With no prior interactions and only one seat, locking in a committed applicant is prudent.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee—I'm Student_E. School_E is my first-choice school, and I’m very eager to enroll if admitted. I’m applying now and would gladly accept an offer immediately. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_E is my top choice. Given all schools share the same priority order (A>B>C>D>E), I have the lowest priority everywhere, so my best chance is to secure my top option immediately before it fills with a higher-priority student. I should apply now and clearly signal strong commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_E is your first choice. We appreciate your strong interest and are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list but ranked lowest. With quota 1 and all schools sharing the same priority order, higher-ranked students (A, B, C, D) are likely to be contested. However, Student_E ranks School_E first and is applying now with commitment, making an immediate secure match possible. Given no prior interactions and the risk of ending unmatched if we wait, accept to lock in a guaranteed fill.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—thank you for your time last round. After considering my options, I’d like to formally apply to School_A. I’m especially interested in a rigorous academic environment with strong teacher support and opportunities to contribute through clubs and peer mentoring. If admitted, I’m ready to commit and would be excited to join your community. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: School_A is on my true list (3rd). It is the only unmatched school left this round, so if I delay I risk ending unmatched. Priorities are identical across schools (A>B>C>D>E), so my position is mid-tier; however, since other schools are already matched, School_A’s remaining choice set is limited and applying now maximizes my chance to secure an acceptable placement rather than risk no match. I already opened with a TALK; now I should apply and signal commitment while briefly reaffirming fit.

conversation.message: Student_C—thank you for your application and for the thoughtful note. We’re happy to offer you admission to School_A. Your interest in rigorous academics, strong teacher support, and contributing through clubs and peer mentoring is exactly the kind of engagement that strengthens our community. If you join us, we’ll make sure you have clear academic advising and plenty of ways to get involved early (including mentoring and leadership pathways in clubs). We’d be excited to welcome you to School_A.
conversation.thought: Student_C is on our true priority list (3rd). We have remaining quota 1 and only Student_C is unmatched, so accepting secures a match within quota with no downside. Student_C expresses strong fit (rigor, support, clubs, mentoring) and willingness to commit, aligning with our values. Accept now to finalize.
